title: 2,800-Mile 2015 Alfa Romeo 4C Launch Edition
description: This 2015 Alfa Romeo 4C Coupe is #320 of 500 Launch Edition examples produced for the North American market, and it remained registered with its original owner until it was acquired by the seller on BaT in September 2023. Subsequent work included fluid changes, replacing the tires, and the installation of a full-body paint protection film, a carbon-fiber engine cover, a billet aluminum coolant expansion tank cap, a custom removable center armrest, and hexagon-pattern floor mats. Launch Edition equipment included a revised front fascia, bi-xenon projector headlamps, carbon-fiber side mirror covers, a carbon-fiber rear spoiler, five-hole dark alloy wheels over red brake calipers, and a sport exhaust system. Additional equipment consists of the Convenience Group, rear parking sensors, cruise control, manually adjustable sport seats, premium speakers, an alarm system, and air conditioning. Finished in Rosso Alfa over black leather and microfiber upholstery, the car is powered by a turbocharged 1.75-liter inline-four paired with a six-speed dual-clutch automatic transaxle. This 4C has 2,800 miles and is now offered New Hampshire with a window sticker, a set of knurled aluminum climate control knobs, a window sticker, an Alfa Romeo Certificate of Authenticity, a limited printing of The 4C Book, accessories, spare parts, a car cover, a clean Carfax report, and a clean New Hampshire title in the seller's name.

text: This 2015 Alfa Romeo 4C Coupe is #320 of 500 Launch Edition examples produced for the North American market, and it remained registered with its original owner until it was acquired by the seller on BaT in September 2023. Subsequent work included fluid changes, replacing the tires, and the installation of a full-body paint protection film, a carbon-fiber engine cover, a billet aluminum coolant expansion tank cap, a custom removable center armrest, and hexagon-pattern floor mats. Launch Edition equipment included a revised front fascia, bi-xenon projector headlamps, carbon-fiber side mirror covers, a carbon-fiber rear spoiler, five-hole dark alloy wheels over red brake calipers, and a sport exhaust system. Additional equipment consists of the Convenience Group, rear parking sensors, cruise control, manually adjustable sport seats, premium speakers, an alarm system, and air conditioning. Finished in Rosso Alfa over black leather and microfiber upholstery, the car is powered by a turbocharged 1.75-liter inline-four paired with a six-speed dual-clutch automatic transaxle. This 4C has 2,800 miles and is now offered New Hampshire with a window sticker, a set of knurled aluminum climate control knobs, a window sticker, an Alfa Romeo Certificate of Authenticity, a limited printing of The 4C Book, accessories, spare parts, a car cover, a clean Carfax report, and a clean New Hampshire title in the seller’s name. The car is finished in Rosso Alfa, and features a Launch Edition-specific front fascia as well as a carbon-fiber central tub, composite bodywork, and aluminum subframes. Additional features include a carbon-fiber rear spoiler and side mirrors, rear parking sensors, bi-xenon headlights, a rear diffuser, and LED taillights. The body and chassis fasteners were re-torqued in 2020, and the seller tells us that paint protection film was applied to the entirety of the body, mirror caps, and vents in December 2023 at a cost of approximately $6,200. Photos of the exterior and rocker panel condition are viewable in the gallery below. The 18″ front and 19″ rear five-hole alloy wheels are mounted with 205/40 front and 235/35 rear Michelin Pilot Sport Cup 2 tires that were installed in May 2025. The car is equipped with a race-tuned suspension, and braking is handled by four-wheel cross-drilled and ventilated rotors with four-piston Brembo front calipers. The brake fluid was flushed in May 2025. The cockpit features twin manually adjustable sport seats upholstered in black leather and microfiber that extends to the dashboard and door panels, and the carbon-fiber monocoque chassis is visible on the center console, floor, and around the door sills. A custom removable center armrest and hexagon-pattern floor mats were added under current ownership, and additional appointments include cruise control, keyless entry, an alarm system, power windows and locks, premium speakers, and air conditioning. A serialized plaque on the center console denotes this car as being #320 of 500 Launch Edition examples produced. The leather-wrapped flat-bottomed steering wheel fronts paddle shifters, a TFT LCD digital gauge cluster with a 6,500-rpm redline tachometer, a speed readout, and auxiliary gauges for coolant temperature and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 2,800 miles, approximately 380 of which were added under current ownership. The mid-mounted and turbocharged 1.75-liter DOHC inline-four features direct fuel injection and was rated at 237 horsepower and 258 lb-ft of torque when new, and it has been retrofitted with a carbon-fiber cover, a black coolant expansion tank cover, and a billet aluminum Alfa Romeo-branded coolant expansion tank cap. The timing belt was replaced in March 2021, and the oil was most recently changed in May 2025. Power is sent to the rear wheels through a six-speed dual-clutch automatic transaxle, and the car is equipped with a sport exhaust system without mufflers. The window sticker shows initial delivery to Criswell Alfa Romeo of Germantown, Maryland, and lists factory colors, equipment, options, and a total price of $71,895. Included in the sale is of the 4C is red Alfa Romeo-branded car cover, a pair of keys, a limited printing of The 4C Book, Knurled Aluminum Climate Control Knobs, an oil removal kit, a tire inflator, a spare coolant expansion tank, service records, and other accessories.
